name: Divvy Cloud Jira Issue Update - Salesforce Jira
description: When there is a new/updated issue in Jira, do action

code.name: updated_issue

block.name: search_sobjects
block.title: Search Jira issues
block.description: Search for Jira issues in Salesforce

extended_input_schema.name: include_combined_attachments
extended_input_schema.label: Select combined attachments
extended_input_schema.hint: Select Yes to obtain data from notes, attachments and files associated to the queried records. Default value is Yes.

block.comment: Check to see if this Jira even exists in Salesforce.  If so, grab the Status and Fix Version

block.name: declare_list
block.title: Create change_list list
block.comment: Create a list to keep track of the changes

block.name: create_document
block.description: Create message using Salesforce Case Comment - Fields Changed in Jira template

dynamicPickListSelection.template_id: Salesforce Case Comment - Fields Changed in Jira

template_id.name: Salesforce Case Comment - Fields Changed in Jira

block.name: call_service_async
block.description: Call recipe Add Salesforce Case Comment for Cases Related to Jira (do not wait for response)

dynamicPickListSelection.flow_id: Add Salesforce Case Comment for Cases Related to Jira

flow_id.name: Callable - Add Salesforce Case Comment for Cases Related to Divvy Cloud Jira

block.comment: This callable recipe will add a comment to all related Cases (and check to make sure that the Case is not closed)
If there was a change, add a comment on all associated Cases

block.name: call_service
block.description: Call recipe Sync Divvy Cloud Jira Issue to Salesforce Jira Issue

dynamicPickListSelection.flow_id: Sync Jira Issue to Salesforce Jira Issue

flow_id.name: Callable - Sync Divvy Cloud Jira Issue to Salesforce Jira Issue

properties.name: remapped_jira_case_associations
properties.label: Remapped Jira/Case Associations
properties.hint: List of the remapped Jira Case Associations

properties.label: Jira Issue Key
properties.name: jira_issue_key
properties.hint: Key of the updated Jira, it will be blank if no Jira was updated

block.comment: Make sure Salesforce has the latest fields from Jira.
If this Jira exists in Salesforce, check to see if the fields have changed and make sure the Salesforce Jira object is updated.

block.name: __adhoc_http_action
block.title: Get Change Log

extended_input_schema.name: path
extended_input_schema.label: Path
extended_input_schema.hint: Base URI is https://divvycloud.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/ - path will be appended to this URI. Use absolute URI to override this base URI.

block.comment: Get the change log to see if the Key has been updated.  We have to do this even if the Jira Issue is not in Salesforce because the previous Key may be mapped in Salesforce.

block.name: search_sobjects
block.title: Search Jira- case associations
block.description: Search for Jira- case associations in Salesforce

extended_input_schema.name: include_combined_attachments
extended_input_schema.label: Select combined attachments
extended_input_schema.hint: Select Yes to obtain data from notes, attachments and files associated to the queried records. Default value is Yes.

block.comment: Check to see if the old Jira Key is mapped to a Case in Salesforce.  If so, remap the old associations.

block.name: call_service
block.description: Call recipe Sync Divvy Cloud Jira Issue to Salesforce Jira Issue

dynamicPickListSelection.flow_id: Sync Jira Issue to Salesforce Jira Issue

flow_id.name: Callable - Sync Divvy Cloud Jira Issue to Salesforce Jira Issue

properties.name: remapped_jira_case_associations
properties.label: Remapped Jira/Case Associations
properties.hint: List of the remapped Jira Case Associations

properties.label: Jira Issue Key
properties.name: jira_issue_key
properties.hint: Key of the updated Jira, it will be blank if no Jira was updated

block.comment: If the Issue Key was updated, then make sure that all the references from the old key are updated to the new key (the callable recipe will detect the redirect and setup the new jira and jira case associations if necessary)
Go through the history of this Issue and see if the Jira was moved to a new project (Key field would be updated)

code.comment: This recipe does 3 things.  1 - add a comment to the Salesforce case if certain fields have been updated in Jira.  2 - sync the Jira fields to the Salesforce Jira Issue object.  3 - check if this Jira has switched projects, this would mean that we need to update old keys in Salesforce to use the new value.
